title: How to Make Peppermint Ice Cream

steps.headline: Heat the half-and-half and sugar into a large saucepan.
steps.description: Stir over low heat and have it simmer.

steps.headline: Beat the egg yolks in a separate bowl with a whisk, until they resemble a light yellow color.
Slowly pour the half-and-half mixture into the egg yolks.
steps.description: Whisk quickly until well-combined and then pour it back into the saucepan.

steps.headline: Simmer until the mixture gets thick, usually taking about 5-7 minutes.
steps.description: Stir occasionally with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a medium-sized bowl.
steps.description: Gently press the strainer down with the wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Stir in the heavy cream and vanilla into the cream mixture.
Have the cream mixture chill in the fridge.
steps.description: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and allow it to chill until the mixture is completely cool.

steps.headline: Make the ice cream.
steps.description: Pour the cream mixture into an ice cream maker. Follow your ice cream maker's package instructions to make the ice cream. Add the crushed peppermint candies.

steps.headline: Transfer the ice cream into a freezer-safe bowl.
Have the ice cream freeze until solid, taking about four hours till overnight.
Serve.
steps.description: Have the ice cream soften for about ten minutes. Scoop the ice cream into a serving bowl. Garnish with extra chopped peppermint candies if desired. Enjoy!

text: Heat the half-and-half and sugar into a large saucepan. Stir over low heat and have it simmer. Beat the egg yolks in a separate bowl with a whisk, until they resemble a light yellow color.  Slowly pour the half-and-half mixture into the egg yolks. Whisk quickly until well-combined and then pour it back into the saucepan. Simmer until the mixture gets thick, usually taking about 5-7 minutes. Stir occasionally with a wooden spoon. Pour the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a medium-sized bowl. Gently press the strainer down with the wooden spoon. Stir in the heavy cream and vanilla into the cream mixture.  Have the cream mixture chill in the fridge. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and allow it to chill until the mixture is completely cool. Make the ice cream. Pour the cream mixture into an ice cream maker. Follow your ice cream maker's package instructions to make the ice cream. Add the crushed peppermint candies. Transfer the ice cream into a freezer-safe bowl. Close the container tightly. Have the ice cream freeze until solid, taking about four hours till overnight.  Serve. Have the ice cream soften for about ten minutes. Scoop the ice cream into a serving bowl. Garnish with extra chopped peppermint candies if desired. Enjoy!
